page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.
page.content: Originally the whole area was heathland crossed by the Great West Road (A30).Camberley did not exist but there were a few isolated buildings such as the Golden(now Jolly)Farmer. The first building was the Obelisk built by John Norris about 1760 to signal to his friend Francis Dashwood of the Hell Fire Club.Camberley began with the setting up of Sandhurst Military College in 1812.Its function was to provide shops,services & labour for the college.As Sandhurst expanded & separated into 2 colleges,so Camber ley grew,its military connection stre- ngthened by officers retiring to the area.Our patch was opened up by large houses with rhododendron drives.With the introduction of the car it became a fashionable area for London commut- ers.Other military developments were R.A.R.D.E.and the WRAC College.
